componentviewer.config.title: Component Viewer Config
componentviewer.config.clipboard.copy.de:
What should be copied to the clipboard.

- Disabled: Nothing

- Component Value: The currently selected component value

- Give Command: A give command yielding the item stack you are currently hovering over
componentviewer.config.clipboard.formatt:
The formatting of the copied component value.

- Sync: The same as for tooltips

- SNBT: Using an SNBT representation just like '/data get'

- JSON: Represented as a JSON object

- Object: Using Java's Object.toString() method. SNBT formatting is used for components of type NbtComponent
componentviewer.config.clipboard.include: Whether to copy the item count of the item stack.
componentviewer.config.clipboard.indenta: The amount of spaces used for indentation. A value of zero means no indentation, essentially creating a one-liner. 'Sync' copies the indentation behavior of tooltips.
componentviewer.config.clipboard.prepend: Add a '/' in front of the give command.
componentviewer.config.clipboard.success: Receive toast notifications for successful copy actions. You will always receive toast notifications for failed copy actions, regardless of this config.
componentviewer.config.clipboard.title: Clipboard
componentviewer.config.tooltip.advanced_: The debug option 'Advanced tooltips' has to be enabled to display components.
componentviewer.config.tooltip.component: Component values will be displayed in addition to component types.

Which components will be listed.

- All: All components currently present on the item stack

- Default: All components that default to the item stack

- Changes: All components that have been added, modified or removed
componentviewer.config.tooltip.display.d:
Specifies the display behavior of components.

- Never: Components will never be displayed

- Hold: Components will be displayed when holding CTRL

- Always: Components will always be displayed
componentviewer.config.tooltip.formattin:
Specifies how component values should be formatted.

- SNBT: Using an SNBT representation just like '/data get'

- JSON: Represented as a JSON object

- Object: Using Java's Object.toString() method. SNBT formatting is used for components of type NbtComponent
componentviewer.config.tooltip.indentati: The amount of spaces used for indentation. A value of zero means no indentation, essentially creating a one-liner.
componentviewer.config.tooltip.title: Tooltips
Formatting error: Try another formatting method
